alert.note: Alert for South Central Utah; Zion National Park (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:43PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Washington and southwestern Kane Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 343 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Kanab, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Zion National Park, Orderville, Mt Carmel and Coral Pink Sand Dunes. This includes US Route 89 between mile markers 70 and 87. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
